intro: Schmaltzia pachyrrhachis, commonly known as the thick-stemmed schmaltzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Schmaltzia pachyrrhachis is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
